text: June unemployment rates ranged from 1.8% in MN to 5.5% in DC.
In Q1 2022, 14 states saw their greatest nominal annual house price growth in three decades.
GDP growth between Q1 2021 and Q1 2022 ranged from -1.7% in Nebraska to 6.6% in Hawaii.
Average private weekly earnings in June ranged from $819 in MS to $1,311 in MA.
Leisure and hospitality jobs in June 2022 were above June 2019 levels in only nine states.
June 2022 state and local public sector jobs were above prepandemic levels in only eight states.
Retail GDP in Q1 2021 was higher than in Q1 2020 and Q1 2022 in 47 states.
Every state (but not DC) saw nominal annual house price increases exceed 10% in Q1 2022.
In June 2022, KY and seven other states saw their lowest unemployment rates in over 45 years.
In Q1 2022, manufacturing GDP was above Q1 2020 levels in MI and 36 other states.
